page.title: 07WILDLIFE
page.content: The block contains very different habitats each with its own type of wildlife. {Adders}slither amongst the rough grass, gorse, bracken and brambles of Cadson Bury. {Dippers}bob up and down on rocks in the nearby river Lynher, and{trout}and{salmon}dart within the deeper pools. {Nightingales}sing above Cadson Bury, whilst{pheasants}shriek in the nearby fields and{woodpeckers drill noisily into trees in Park Wood. At night{foxes}raid local farmyards and{badgers}set out in search of{earthworms, grubs, bulbs}and {berries}in the local woodlands. {Bats swoop over hedgerows and the area echoes with the hoots of{owls. At dawn families of{rabbits}graze on Cadson Bury and{shrews, voles}and {mice}scurry amongst the hedgerows, beneath hovering{buzzards}and{hawks.
